CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Treatment Recommended stage positioned above or below the Treatment Completed stage?
SRP.A: The Treatment Recommended stage is positioned {above} the Treatment Completed stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Diagnostic Testing?
VE.A: The value of stage Diagnostic Testing is {2832}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Treatment Initiated?
VE.A: The value of stage Treatment Initiated is {511}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Diagnostic Testing, with a value of {2832}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Treatment Completed, with a value of {413}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Diagnostic Testing to stage Diagnosis Confirmed?
SC.A: Decreased by {1220} Patients from stage Diagnostic Testing to stage Diagnosis Confirmed.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 704? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Diagnostic Testing} stage has {2832}, the {Diagnosis Confirmed} stage has {1612}, the {Treatment Recommended} stage has {898}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 704? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Treatment Initiated} stage has {511}, the {Treatment Completed} stage has {413}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 462 and 2222? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Diagnosis Confirmed} stage has {1612}, the {Treatment Recommended} stage has {898}, the {Treatment Initiated} stage has {511}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Diagnosis Confirmed to Treatment Recommended, or from stage Diagnostic Testing to Diagnosis Confirmed?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Diagnostic Testing} to {Diagnosis Confirmed} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Treatment Recommended to Treatment Initiated, from stage Diagnostic Testing to Diagnosis Confirmed, or from stage Diagnosis Confirmed to Treatment Recommended?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Diagnostic Testing} to stage {Diagnosis Confirmed} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Diagnostic Testing} and {Diagnosis Confirmed} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Treatment Initiated} and {Treatment Completed} stages.
